content: As of 2021, over 100 women have been appointed as Knight Bachelor since the title was first created in the 12th century. Women have been eligible for the honor of being appointed a Knight Bachelor since the early 20th century. However, it wasn't until the 1970s that the first women were appointed. Since then, there has been a steady increase in the number of women receiving the honor, and in recent years, the number of women receiving a knighthood has been roughly equal to the number of men.
